description.narrative: The project will be focus on improvement of the legal base and systems in the area of labour and employment, establishment of Labour Safety and Standards Service and development of the Public Employment Service.

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

description.narrative: 1.1 Share of legal documents reviewed in line with international standards 1.2 Share of the Ministry’s specialists who studied international standards and best practices in the area of labour and employment 2.1 Share of recommendations adopted to modernize the current labour safety system in Turkmenistan 2.2 Number of the Ministry’s specialists who trained on international labour safety standards 3.1 Share of recommendations adopted to improve ICT system of the public employment service 3.2 Share of recommendations adopted to improve functions of the public employment service and corresponding employment fund in Turkmenistan 3.3 Availability of the methodology to study the labour market as well as methodological tools and techniques to forecast demand and supply on the labour market 3.4 Number of the Ministry’s specialists trained on estimation and forecasting demand and supply on the labour market

comment.narrative: 1.1 Zero 1.2 Zero 2.1 Zero 2.2 Zero 3.1 Zero 3.2 Zero 3.3 Zero 3.4 Zero

1.1 70% Achieved. Share of legal documents reviewed in line with international standards – achieved at 70% instead of planned 50%. 30% work is left for the review of the complete legislation. 1.2 50% Partially achieved. During the year of 2018 a visit of Byelorussian specialists to Turkmenistan and a inter-agency Round table were conducted to present and share the knowledge and best practices on the subject. The Study visit to Turkey that was planned for 2018 has been moved to 2019 due to the changes in the labour and employment system in the hosting country. However, the complete implementation of the indicators is expected by the end of 2019. 2.1 50% - Partially achieved. The project completed its task and the recommendations on the modernization of the current labour system have been developed and submitted to the Ministry specialists for review. The Ministry is in the process of review and analysis prior to adoption. Another major step is pending - the transfer of labour safety system ownership to the Ministry needs to be settled in order for the recommendations to be adopted. 2.2. 10 - Achieved. 3.1. 0% - Not achieved. This is a challenging task in terms of the topic sensitivity and finding qualified human resources to complete the task. Evaluation of this assignment needs to be done at the next Project Board meeting to advise on the direction in this regards. 3.2. 20% - Partially achieved. A round of trainings was conducted by the Technical Advior of the project for the specialists of regional public employment services. International Consultant was hired at the end of 2018 to assist with inclusive employment strategies and active labour programmes. Report is expected at the end of January. 3.3 Yes - Achieved. International Consultant was hired to assist with developing the methodology to study the labour market as well as methodological tools and techniques to forecast demand and supply on the labour market. Report is expected by the end of January 2019. 3.4 10 - Achieved.

1.1. 60% of legal documents reviewed in line with international standards - achieved. New edition of the Labour Code prepared and submitted to the Ministry of Labour and Social Protection of Population. 1.2. 100% of Ministry’s specialists studied international standards and best practices in labour and employment - partially achieved. Study visit was organized for Ministrys specialists to Turkey; New edition of the Labour code was presented to the Ministrys specialists. 2.1. 80% of recommendations adopted to modernize the current labour safety system - Achieved. Recommendations were submitted and are currently being considered by the Ministry for adoption. 2.2. 15 Ministry’s specialists trained in international labour safety standards - Achieved. International Consultant was hired to conduct training on Labour safety for Ministrys specialists; 3.1. 100% of recommendations adopted to improve ICT system of the public employment service - Partially achieved. The work is in process: mobile app is completed and will be launched next week. This task is transferred to PVE project and will be implemented in 2020. 3.2. 80% of recommendations adopted to improve functions of public employment service - Partially achieved and transferred to PVE project. 3.4. 10 Ministry’s specialists trained on estimation and forecasting demanding supply on the labour market - Partially achieved and transferred to PVE project.
